Mod the Toad 
 Alice Mulwa 
 English 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 It was a cold and wet morning in the
 forest. 
 
 
 Mod the litle toad was tired of
 swiming in cold water. 
 
 
 “I ned to leave this place during the
 rainy season,” she said to herself.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 1  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 “I want an adventure,” said Mod to the 
 
 terapin. “I must find out about the 
 world.” 
 
 
 “Be careful, don’t leave the water for to 
 long or your skin wil dry out,” warned the 
 
 wise terapin. 
 
 
 At that time, toads stil had smoth wet 
 skin like frogs. Without water, their skins 
 would become to dry. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 2  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 But Mod the toad was curious. “I must
 find out, I must go beyond the forest,”
 she said. 
 
 
 Mod hoped out of the water. Hop, hop,
 she went, away from the river. She had
 
 fun jumping over the rocks, acros gras,
 and past trenches. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 3  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 She heard the sound of an airplane. Mod 
 
 loked up into the sky. “What is up 
 there?” she asked, “I wonder if the clouds 
 are talking.” But no one answered her. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Mod caried on her way. She met a
 
 chameleon for the first time. He was next
 to a large pudle of water. 
 
 
 “Helo, I am on my way to dry land for
 adventure. What can you tel me?” she
 
 asked. 
 
 
 “Nothing much stranger. It rains here to.
 Lots of rain and lots of flies,” replied the
 chameleon. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 5  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 As Chameleon was talking, his body 
 
 changed colour. Mod got a fright. She 
 quickly said godbye to Chameleon and 
 hoped into a nearby bush. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 6  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 But she was unlucky. Hyena was busy
 burning bushes in preparation for
 
 planting season. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 7  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Mod did not want to turn around for fear 
 of meting the chameleon again. She 
 stayed in the bush, only her round eyes 
 
 could be sen. They were big with fear. 
 Mod was surounded by fire! 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 8  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Mod did not know where to go. The
 
 flames began to burn her back. Then the
 litle toad remembered the pudle of
 water where she met the chameleon. She
 
 closed her eyes, held her breath, and
 jumped high in the direction of the
 
 pudle. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 9  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 She was lucky this time. She landed in 
 the pudle, and the water put out the 
 
 flames that were burning her skin. But 
 the damage was done. When she came 
 out of the pudle, the skin on her back 
 
 was ful of blisters. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 10  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Mod did not want an adventure anymore.
 She wanted to go home. But she did not
 
 know the way back to her river in the
 forest. 
 
 
 So the litle toad found a col, dark place
 under a rock and sadly made a new
 
 home. Her burned skin slowly healed, but
 it was dry and bumpy. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 1  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 This is why toads have dry rough skin, 
 and can live away from water. 
 
 
 Frogs stil have smoth wet skin and 
 ned to stay where it’s wet.
